Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky brown with traces of added white bands around bottom of foot; reserved edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding Simple Animal Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos 1991, no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Histria. The number '358' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.2.12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1144) (phase 2)
